Detection of suspicious file copy or mov.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Sysmon Event ID 1, Sysmon Event ID 11
Detection of suspicious file copy or mov.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 (Object Access) or Sysmon logs (Event ID 1 for process command line, Event ID 11 for file creation) for file operations explicitly targeting removable drive paths (e.g., D:\*, E:\*). Correlate file creation/modification events on removable media paths with the processes responsible. Use descriptive statistics to baseline typical file sizes, types, or volumes copied to removable media and flag outliers.

Execution of unauthorized or suspicious.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation). Correlate process creation events with host system events indicating removable media device connection. Filter for processes with unusual names, paths, or command line arguments executed shortly after removable media is mounted. Calculate entropy measures on command line strings or file names created on the removable media to identify suspicious patterns.
